entry.title: Movies and Limited Series
entry.content:
So lately I've been watching a lot of Netflix.

Generally I'm not the kind of person that consumes a lot of media. I'd rather make things; I find creating things way more satisfying.

However, I got a bit burned out in terms of ideas — I didn't know what to build — enery, and time (school am I right ✨). So, instead I spent about 20 hours of my life staring at a screen, looking at fictional characters living their almost perfect made-up lives.

Anyways, I really enjoyed these in particular:

  • After
  • Tick, tick… BOOM!
  • Heartstopper
  • Inventing Anna
  • Bohemian Rhapsody
  • Love, Rosie
  • Friends with Benefits
  • Lady Chatterley's Lover
  • The Girl Nextdoor
  • Queen's Gambit
  • Don't Look Up
  • Dirty Lines
  • The Social Network
  • The Playlist
  • The Social Dilemma
  • Yesterday
  • I Used to Be Famous
  • We Are the Wave

I really enjoyed the mini series in particular; it allows the filmmaker to tell a more detailed story, yet it doesn't require as much time (and commitment) to watch, opposed to, forexample, a 7-season-long show.

A movie feels short when you're used to a series. But that's part of the appeal I think. A movie doesn't try to suck you in, like a series does. It just tells a story.

Context

I wrote this a while back (somewhere fall last year), but I forgot to publish it. I found the draft yesterday.

Also, a lot of movies listed above share one common theme: they're all semi-related to the reproductive system; I'm a teenager, after all ;)
